subject: Career
title: Bureaucracy: Weber's Iron Cage
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Bureaucracy: Weber's Iron Cage.

hook.text: A simple expense report requires four approvals, two forms, and a three-week wait. Welcome to bureaucracy.

buildup.text: Max Weber saw bureaucracy as rational: clear rules, defined roles, predictable processes.

discovery.text: But Weber warned of the 'iron cage' â€” systems designed for efficiency that trap people in rigid processes.

twist.text: Every rule was created to solve a problem. But rules accumulate. Eventually, the rules become the problem.

climax.text: Navigating bureaucracy is a political skill: know when to follow the process and when to escalate around it.

punchline.text: Rules serve the system. Know when the system should serve you.

quiz.question: What is Weber's 'iron cage' of bureaucracy?
options: Systems designed for efficiency that trap people in rigid processes
